articles.headline: In Fight Over Piracy Bills, New Economy Rises Against Old
articles.snippet: The legislative battle over two once-obscure measures to combat the looting of online content may prove to be a turning point for how Washington does business.
articles.abstract: The legislative battle over two once-obscure measures to combat the looting of online content may prove to be a turning point for how Washington does business.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the powerful world of old media mobilized to win passage of an online antipiracy bill, it marshaled the reliable giants of K Street — the United States Chamber of Commerce, the Recording Industry Association of America and, of course, the motion picture lobby, with its new chairman, former Senator Christopher J. Dodd, the Connecticut Democrat and an insider’s insider.

articles.headline: Poll Shows Obama’s Vulnerability With Swing Voters
articles.snippet: Most swing voters disapprove of how President Obama has dealt with the economy and are not clear on his aims for a second term, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.
articles.abstract: Most swing voters disapprove of how President Obama has dealt with the economy and are not clear on his aims for a second term, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama opens his re-election bid facing significant obstacles among independent voters, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll, with the critical piece of the electorate that cemented his victory four years ago open to denying him a second term.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Dalia Sussman

articles.headline: Headphones to Shut Out the World
articles.snippet: What do you look for in noise-canceling headphones? Music fidelity? Reasonable price? Bose has dominated the market, but here’s a look at the latest models from 10 other companies.
articles.abstract: What do you look for in noise-canceling headphones? Music fidelity? Reasonable price? Bose has dominated the market, but here’s a look at the latest models from 10 other companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the olden days, you didn’t need much to enjoy air travel: a pair of goggles, a trusty biplane and a song in your heart. These days, the equipment list is slightly longer: a roll-on bag, a neck pillow and an eye mask — not to mention T.S.A.-friendly slip-on shoes, a fold-out laptop case and an all-plastic watch.

articles.headline: Warm Winter Deflates Prospects for Retailers
articles.snippet: Above-average temperatures across the United States thus far are hurting retail sales, and retailers are running out of time to sell their winter inventory.
articles.abstract: Above-average temperatures across the United States thus far are hurting retail sales, and retailers are running out of time to sell their winter inventory.
articles.lead_paragraph: As winter approached, retailers ordered clothes for cold weather, arranged their stores for cold weather and then just started hoping for cold weather.

articles.headline: Hedge Funds May Sue Greece if It Tries to Force Losses
articles.snippet: Several funds plan to go to the European Court of Human Rights if Greece doesn’t make good on its bond payments.
articles.abstract: Several funds plan to go to the European Court of Human Rights if Greece doesn’t make good on its bond payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Hedge funds have been known to use hardball tactics to make money. Now they have come up with a new one: suing Greece in a human rights court to make good on its bond payments.

articles.headline: With Twitter, Blackouts and Demonstrations, Web Flexes Its Muscle
articles.snippet: In an unusual orchestration, the Web buzzed with protests large and small on Wednesday, and some opponents of Congressional legislation took their opposition offline, too.
articles.abstract: In an unusual orchestration, the Web buzzed with protests large and small on Wednesday, and some opponents of Congressional legislation took their opposition offline, too.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Web buzzed with protests large and small on Wednesday as the tech industry rallied against Congressional legislation to curb Internet piracy.

articles.headline: Romney Riches Are Being Seen as New Hurdle
articles.snippet: With a fortune estimated to be as large as a quarter of a billion dollars, Mitt Romney is among the wealthiest men ever to run for president.
articles.abstract: With a fortune estimated to be as large as a quarter of a billion dollars, Mitt Romney is among the wealthiest men ever to run for president.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a fortune estimated to be as large as a quarter of a billion dollars, Mitt Romney is among the wealthiest men ever to run for president.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore, David Kocieniewski and Michael Luo

articles.headline: Mexico’s Drug War Bloodies Areas Thought Safe
articles.snippet: The drug carnage is spreading to Mexico’s interior and south, a trend believed to be linked to a widening turf war between the country’s two biggest criminal organizations.
articles.abstract: The drug carnage is spreading to Mexico’s interior and south, a trend believed to be linked to a widening turf war between the country’s two biggest criminal organizations.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — The Mexican drug war that has largely been defined by violence along the border is intensifying in interior and southern areas once thought clear of the carnage, broadening a conflict that has already overwhelmed the authorities and dispirited the public, according to analysts and new government data.
